meanings.definition: Serving as a guardian or protector.
meanings.sent1: The tutelar angel watched over the children as they played in the park.
meanings.sent2: The community center had a tutelar role in ensuring the safety of its residents.
meanings.sent3: The tutelar squirrel made sure no acorn was left behind, even organizing them by size.
meanings.sent4: Her tutelar presence enveloped him like a warm, protective cloak.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse stood as a tutelar beacon, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: Relating to a guardian or protector.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll contained tutelar spells to ward off evil spirits.
meanings.sent2: The knight's armor bore intricate designs of tutelar symbols for protection.
meanings.sent3: The tutelar amulet glowed softly, granting its wearer a sense of security.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a tutelar quality, calming all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with tutelar creatures, each watching over their own domain.

meanings.sent1: The wise owl was seen as the tutelar of the forest, guiding lost travelers home.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins held the statue of a tutelar deity, revered by the locals.
meanings.sent3: The tutelar of the library was a friendly cat who kept the books safe from mice.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was believed to be the tutelar of the village, bringing prosperity to all.
meanings.sent5: The tutelar of the sea was said to be a mystical mermaid, protecting sailors from storms.
